objective: Comprehensive PR review of #871 (Agent coding standards review) using parallel review agents

key_decisions.rationale: Reduce token bloat (491 lines to 183 lines), maintain just-in-time loading principle
key_decisions.chosen: Routing index with canonical security patterns

key_decisions.decision: Remove Python 3.11+ from AGENTS.md tech stack
key_decisions.rationale: ADR-005 mandates PowerShell-only with SkillForge as sole exception. Python entry contradicted constraints.
alternatives: Add ADR amendment for broader Python use

key_decisions.rationale: Enable cross-tool consistency (Copilot, Claude, Codex, Cursor, VSCode). Single source for scripts directory guidance.

key_decisions.decision: Move exit code guidance to ADR-035
key_decisions.rationale: Ensure consistent application across all tools. ADR is canonical source for standards.
key_decisions.chosen: ADR-035 as single source of truth

items: Fixed Python claim in AGENTS.md (removed contradiction to ADR-005)
Added exit code guidance to ADR-035
2 critical issues identified (Python claim, Forgetful tool name)
4 positive findings (security patterns, test examples, etc.)

artifacts.summary: Analyzed documentation accuracy. Found 2 critical factual inaccuracies, 4 improvement opportunities.
Reviewed project guidelines compliance. Identified Python/ADR-005 conflict and document purpose drift.
Applied non-functional clarity improvements to examples and test descriptions.
Implemented all architectural changes: routing-index refactor, scripts/AGENTS.md consolidation, ADR-035 updates.
